page.title: 19AUCHTERMUCHTY..RECREATION
page.content: The rural area within our D_Block lends itself well to all sorts of country pastimes. Walking and rambling along the many country lanes and old coach roads is very popular for all ages, while for the younger generation (and the more energetic elders!) there is motorbike scrambling along the farm tracks and in the Rossie Den quarry. This does not meet with the approval of the farmers and local land owners. Some of the older members of the community remember the times (pre WW2) when there was a golf course on the western side of Rossie Farm. Our map area has always been much used for outdoor recreation. Indeed, the southern part of the map was part of the hunting estate of Falkland Palace, a favourite haunt of Mary Queen of Scots!
